view

Class MainWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • view.MainWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MainWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is the main window class that presented to the user in the beginning and works as singleton aggregating most of actions and passing them to external listeners
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    kornicameister
    See Also:
    java.swing.JFrame, Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.swing.JButton aboutMe
      JButton to show JFrame containing currently loggeed user informations and statistics
      private javax.swing.JPanel actionsPanel
      JPanel to aggregate action buttons
      private javax.swing.JPanel bottomPanel
      JPanel containing: dynamic status bar, displaying runtime information constant status bar, displaying database usage statistic
      private javax.swing.JPanel collectionView
      JPanel to hold collection view, that will be computeted and presented in user specified form, meaning as: covers composition list of entities
      private javax.swing.JPanel contentPane
      JPanel for entire JFrame, all elements are going to be placed upon him
      private javax.swing.JButton editButton
      JButton to edit selected, from Collection view, item
      private javax.swing.JButton exitButton
      JButton to exit from the application.
      private java.lang.String groupBy
      Represent choosen category which is used to group collection view againts specified criteria
      private javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar
      Menu bar of the main windows, contains all the actions even those not included in main window content area
      private javax.swing.JButton newItem
      JButton to add new item to the database
      When triggered user is asked what kind of item he would like to add only when Collection view is set to ALL
      private javax.swing.JButton publishButton
      JButton to trigger action responsible for publishing local collection and placing it on the remote server
      private static long serialVersionUID
      The value of this constant is 2740437090361841747L and it was autogenerated
      private StatusBar statusBar
      StatusBar to print runtime information
      private javax.swing.JButton toogleConnection
      button to toogle connection by following pattern when disconnected, connection attempt will be performed + user list will be displayed when connection, connection will be lost What is important here, that connection is understood as being logged in to program,not database
      private javax.swing.JToolBar toolBar
      ToolBar aggregates buttons triggering most used actions.
      private javax.swing.JScrollPane userList
      JScrollPanel containing list of user located at the remote server Users that are friends are marked highlighted, those considered foes are blocked

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void establishActionConnections()
      method goes throughout all fields of MainWindow and add actionListeners to every each one of them that requires it
      private void initBottomPanel()
      Method is taking care of initializing bottom panel that contains statusBar MainWindow#databaseStatusBar publishButton
      private void initCollectionView()
      Method initialized collection view along with all subcomponents
      private void initMenuBar()
      Method initialize menuBar and its content along with all required listeners that are to listen key shortcuts or clicks triggering some action
      private void initToolBar()
      Method initialize toolbar of the application by adding shortcut buttons triggering top actions from each menu and place it on panel
      private void initUserContent()
      Method is taking care of initializing window content, that is: collection view friends list friends interaction block buttons and placing it on layouts
      private void initUserList()
      Method initializes userList panel along with all subcomponents actions and buttons

      • menuBar

        private javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar
        Menu bar of the main windows, contains all the actions even those not included in main window content area

      • toolBar

        private javax.swing.JToolBar toolBar
        ToolBar aggregates buttons triggering most used actions. Contains:
        • zoom combo box
        • group by combo box
        • search text field
        • search button
        to perform operations againt collection view

      • contentPane

        private javax.swing.JPanel contentPane
        JPanel for entire JFrame, all elements are going to be placed upon him

      • collectionView

        private javax.swing.JPanel collectionView
        JPanel to hold collection view, that will be computeted and presented in user specified form, meaning as:
        • covers composition
        • list of entities

      • bottomPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel bottomPanel
        JPanel containing:
        • dynamic status bar, displaying runtime information
        • constant status bar, displaying database usage statistic
        See Also:
        MainWindow#databaseStatusBar, statusBar

      • userList

        private javax.swing.JScrollPane userList
        JScrollPanel containing list of user located at the remote server Users that are friends are marked highlighted, those considered foes are blocked

        StatusBar to print runtime information

      • publishButton

        private javax.swing.JButton publishButton
        JButton to trigger action responsible for publishing local collection and placing it on the remote server

      • groupBy

        private java.lang.String groupBy
        Represent choosen category which is used to group collection view againts specified criteria

      • toogleConnection

        private javax.swing.JButton toogleConnection
        button to toogle connection by following pattern
        • when disconnected, connection attempt will be performed + user list will be displayed
        • when connection, connection will be lost
        What is important here, that connection is understood as 
         being logged in to program,not database

      • exitButton

        private javax.swing.JButton exitButton
        JButton to exit from the application.
        Notice that exit process will trigger database disconnection event

      • newItem

        private javax.swing.JButton newItem
        JButton to add new item to the database
        When triggered user is asked what kind of item he would like to add only when Collection view is set to ALL

      • editButton

        private javax.swing.JButton editButton
        JButton to edit selected, from Collection view, item

      • aboutMe

        private javax.swing.JButton aboutMe
        JButton to show JFrame containing currently loggeed user informations and statistics
